subject: DEBT MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE
body:
DEBT MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE
Office: plot 228 Constitution Avenue, Central Business District.
PMB:532, Garki,Abuja,Nigeria..
 
Dear. Beneficiary.
 
The reason why you have not received your own Fund is because of the involvement of the corrupt officials and impostors.
Now I  want to inform you that we have resolved the issues surrounding your long overdue Contract / Inheritance Fund.
 
You are among the Eligible Beneficiaries that  will received an official Waiver which mean that you are going to pay any fees or charges to receive your own Fund, only what you are required to Pay is the Waiver Registration money which is $125.00 only and after that your fund will be processed and transferred to your designated bank account/
 
This process will take only 7days and you will confirm your Fund in your Bank Account.
 
Get back to us with your details as soon as possible so we can proceed.
 
We rae sorry for any delay or inconveniences you might encounter in the past.
 
Regards.
 
Mr.Adeshina Kolade
Director.

subject: Re:   DEBT MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE
body:
Hello Kolade,

Thank you for reaching out and informing me about this. It's quite a surprise to hear that I have a long overdue Contract Fund. Could you please provide more details about this contract? When was it established and what is it related to?

Also, could you clarify what the Waiver money is for? And how much exactly is it? 

I'm looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Gail

Attention: Gail

I received your response in regards to the email we sent to you regarding
your Inheritance fund.

I want to let you know that a lots of contracts such as oil and gas  pipe
lines installations, refineries, railways  was executed here in Nigeria by
foreign contractors and engineer's  many years ago  but fortunately or
unfortunately some of the contractors died without their contracts funds
being paid to them in full when they are alive due to some circumstances
while some WILL their funds to their relatives as their NEXT OF KIN  that
will  inherit fund left behind.

We sent that email to you because your email details is on the list of the
beneficiaries who have not received their own inheritances fund.

Regarding the Waiver,  there is an official Waiver approved on behalf of
every eligible beneficiaries like you that will enable them receive their
fund without paying any bank transfer charges or clearance fees.

So all you need to do is pay the waiver fee and the fund will be release to
you without hitch or hindrances.

Get back to me with your details so we can proceed.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director

subject: Re:
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. It's quite interesting to learn about these contracts and the funds left behind. I'm curious, how did my email end up on this list? 

You mentioned a waiver fee that needs to be paid in order to release the fund. Could you please provide more details about this fee? How much is it and what is the process of payment?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Re:
body:
Attention: Gail

I understand your curiosity but the truth here is that this fund  is real.

In our payment file here we have other beneficiaries who have received
their own fund while some are on the process.

What you are about to receive is the sum of $2,500.000.00 ( Two Million
Five Hundred Thousand United States Dollars)  the said fund will be
released to you through our authorized paying bank.

To start the process you are required to provide the followings:

(1) your full name

(2) your address

(3) your direct phone number

(4) a copy of your valid Identity card.

After providing the above information we will apply for the Official Waiver
on your behalf which you will pay only $125.00 for application and the
registration and once that is done, you will received all the legal
documents.

Then after that we will submit your details to the Authorized paying bank
for them to transfer the funds to your account without any delay.

Get to me with the above required information's so we can proceed.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director

subject: Re:
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your message and the opportunity to receive such a large sum of money. It's not every day that one gets an offer like this! 

I'm curious, how did I become eligible for this fund? And could you tell me more about the Official Waiver? What is it exactly and why do I need to pay for it?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Hello
body:
Attention: Gail

I received your email and I understand how you feel because before now you
are not aware of the inheritance fund  but I want to assure you that this
is real and its risk free.

Many beneficiaries like you have received their own , all you need to do is
to believe it and you will see what will happen, this is a transaction you
will never regret.

Now regarding the official waiver, normally  the paying bank will charge
you  before  you will receive the fund but with the waiver the paying bank
will not charge you any money such as bank processing fee,  cost of
transfer (COT) you will not pay any tax clearance fee.

That waiver is an official documents , it will be issued from the  Federal
Ministry of  Finance under the instruction from the   Presidency , it
authorized the deduction of any fees or charges from the paying bank., it
also a guarantee letter.

It is for the benefits of the beneficiary, once we issued it to you and
forward the copies with your details to the bank they will process the fund
and transfer it to your  designated bank account without any delay.

Get back to me so we can proceed.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I must admit, this is all very new to me and I'm trying my best to understand it all.

So, if I understood correctly, the waiver from the Federal Ministry of Finance will ensure that no fees or charges will be deducted from the fund by the paying bank? That sounds like a great benefit!

Could you please explain a bit more about how this process works? How is it possible for the bank not to charge any fees?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Attention: Gail.

I know you are trying your best to understand this transaction very well
and I have tried my best also to explain it to you.

Normally in this kind foreign transaction, the bank here will charge you
much money for some clearance before they will released the money to you.

Let me also tell you that this fund is under insurance Bond and based on
that the paying bank cannot deduct any money from the initial fund deposit
for any reasons. But you must understand that the deposited fund has
accrued interest.

Right now what you are about to receive is the initial deposit of the sum
of $2,500.000.00. So that is exact Amount the bank will transfer to you.

To start the process ,you need to provide the information required from you
as I stated in the email I sent to you yesterday. Once you provides the
required information's then you will send the $125.00 to enable us get the
waiver on your behalf then after we will send you copies with all the legal
documents for you to signed and returned it then after we will submit all
to the paying bank for them to process the transfer. The bank will not ask
you to pay any other money.

This process will take less than 14 days and you will confirmed the fund in
your bank account.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I appreciate your efforts in making this clear to me. 

I understand that the fund is under insurance bond and no deductions can be made from it. Also, I'm glad to know that the bank will not ask me to pay any other money.

However, I'm a bit confused about the process you mentioned. Could you please elaborate on what exactly is required from me? And what do you mean by 'waiver'? 

Also, could you clarify how long this process will take? You mentioned 'less than days', but didn't specify the exact number.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Attention: Gail.

I have already told you that the waiver stands as a guarantee letter , if
it issued to any beneficiary it empowers the beneficiary to receive  his or
her fund without paying any other fees to the bank.

To start the process below are what is required from you.

1) your full name

(2) your address

(3) your direct phone number

(4) a copy of your valid Identity card.

Once the waiver is issued on your behalf we will send you the copy with
copies of  the fund release order and those copies will be also forwarded
to the paying bank. The paying bank will send you their fund transfer form
which you will fill for them to process the transfer and transfer the fund
in your account.

I told you that all this will be concluded within 14 official working days.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's really helpful to understand the process better. I'm just curious, how does this waiver work exactly? And what is its significance in the whole process?

Also, could you please tell me more about the fund release order? What information does it contain and why is it important?

I'm sorry for all these questions, but I find this all very fascinating and want to understand it fully.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Hello, Gail.

In response to your email,  I have already told you that the waiver we are
talking about is an official document that gives beneficiary authority to
receive his or fund without paying any charges or levies to the paying bank.

The fund  released order is also an official documents which will be also
issued from the Federal Ministry of Finance giving an official approval for
the paying bank to release the fund to the beneficiary.

I told you that this process will not take more than 2 weeks to be
finalized.

So send the information's required from you if you want us to proceed.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation about the waiver and fund release order. It's quite interesting to learn about these official documents.

I'm curious, could you please elaborate more on how this process works? And what exactly is required from me at this stage? I just want to make sure I understand everything correctly before we proceed further.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Attention: Gail.

To start the process of the fund release order and the waiver below are
information's required from you.

1) your full name

(2) your address

(3) your direct phone number

(4) a copy of your valid Identity card.

Once  we received the above information's  from you we will send you
information on how you are going to send the $125.00 , then once the fund
release order and the  waiver is issued on your behalf we will send you the
copies to you and  also we will forwarded to the paying bank.

The paying bank will contact you and  send you their fund transfer form
which you will fill for them to process the transfer and transfer the fund
in your account.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Directorate

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your message and the detailed explanation of the process. It sounds very interesting! I'm curious, could you tell me more about this fund release order and waiver? What exactly are they and how do they work?

Also, I'd love to know more about the paying bank. Which bank is it? And how does the transfer form work?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Attention: Gail

I know you are trying to understand everything correctly and I have
explained it very well to you unless you are not reading my email very well.

You should know what the fund release order stands for and also the waiver.

The paying bank cannot release that fund without confirmation of the fund
release order from the Ministry of Finance.

The waiver stands as an authorization given on your behalf to receive your
fund without paying any charges.

When I say that the paying will contact you ,then all you need to do is to
follow the instruction's I'm giving to you.

Send the information's required from you if you are ready to receive this
fund,
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Hello Mr. Adeshina Kolade,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. I must admit, some of this is a bit over my head, but I'm trying to understand it all. 

So, if I've got this right, the fund release order is something that comes from the Ministry of Finance and it's necessary for the paying bank to release the funds? And the waiver means that I won't have to pay any charges to receive my funds?

You mentioned that the paying bank will contact me and that I should follow your instructions. Could you please clarify what these instructions are? Also, could you tell me more about what is required from me?

I appreciate your patience with me as I try to understand all of this.

Best wishes,
Gail

subject: Re: Hello
body:
Attention: Gail.

Below are the information's required from you to process the fund release
order and the waiver and then after the paying bank will contact you and I
will apse give you the contact of the paying bank.

1) your full name

(2) your address

(3) your direct phone number

(4) a copy of your valid Identity card.
Regards
Mr  Adeshina Kolade
Director.
